title.value: Designing of herbages on the drained mineral soils of the Poozerye [Belarus]
Конструирование травостоев на осушенных минеральных почвах Поозерья [Беларусь]

person.name: Saskevich, L.A., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center for Arable Farming (Belarus). Institute for Land Reclamation

abstract.value: Perennial leguminous grasses appear low-cost high-productive feeds with stable crop yield level and high digestible protein content. Utilization of leguminous grasses in animal feeding rations allow balancing feeds with protein content and saving mineral nitrogen. Economic efficiency of utilization of perennial leguminous grasses composes more than 20%. On the basis of integrated literature data and results of own experiments the general approaches to the design of meadow agrophytocenosis, adapted for northern part of the Republic of Belarus are formulated. Dependence of the crop yield of cereal grass stand (1-st mowing) on the nitrogen fertilizers' dozes is evaluated. Crop yield level of the grass mixture (Trifolium pratense, Lucerne and Bromus inermis), cultivated on drained sod-podzolic clay soil is evaluated. Ranking of the grasses according the specie activity (two-cut use) is presented. Structure of the grass mixtures depending on the methods of calculation of seeding rate is analyzed. The most important indexes of evaluation of the technology of perennial grasses management are calculated. Dependence between green leaves number and terms of grass harvesting is analyzed. The most effective leguminous grass (Lucerne) for feeding use is determined.
